intro: Acisanthera variabilis var. triflora, commonly known as the variable acisanthera, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are ovate with serrated edges and often have a fuzzy texture. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
